removed this as well for now, see talk.
minor edit, formatted source with <ref></ref> command
Can someone please fix Source formatting for me, so it's in References and not in brackets? I don't know how to do it.
Jasenovac: victims of war according to data from the Yugoslav Institute of Statistics(1964), Bosniak Institute, Zurich, Sarajevo, 1998.
/* External links, references, resources */ Add tr:Yahudi SoykÄ±rÄ±mÄ± per request
rv [[Special:Contributions/Matthew Chowder|Matthew Chowder]] ([[User talk:Matthew Chowder|talk]]) to [[Special:Contributions/Dado|Dado]] ([[User talk:Dado|talk]])
Small addition, Bosniak victims - Mustafa Imamovic, History of Bosniaks
Delink months and days of week &/or general fixes using [[Wikipedia:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
/* Others */ added others who were targeted.
/* Netherlands */ some creates the impression that this was rare; I took out any description
/* European occupied countries */ -article; this is not a sentence
/* Religious hatred and racism */ Fixing spelling
/* Jews */ comment out Himmler/Hitler img: it is non-critical here, COPYRIGHT UNCLEAR
/* Jewish Resistance */ {{main|Jewish resistance movement}}, rm picture (copyright is unclear, also not very relevant - let's try to find a better one)
/* Netherlands */ focusing the text a little; the article is about the Holocaust in general
/* Netherlands */ fixing more typos and translating from Dutch to English
/* Netherlands */ focusing and working away typos
/* Netherlands */ Sinti and Roma in NL added
The Netherlands can't be considered a collaborationist country + typing error corrected
/* The Netherlands */ no need for the article
/* The occupied Netherlands */ other countries were also occupied, occupied here is used to differentiate with non-occupied
/* The occupied Netherlands */ combining the texts
/* The occupied Netherlands */ typing error corrected + geographical adjustment
/* Netherlands */ seems only fair, as the section header is "collaborist countries", yet some countries have "fascist or Vichy infront of their names ...
/* Netherlands, Norway, Slovakia */ figures for the Netherlands
/* Netherlands, Norway, Slovakia */ Dutch civilian administration didn't participate

/* Etymology and usage of the term */ format
/* Religious hatred and racism */ spelling error
[[WP:CITE]] your sources please, and then consider whether this trivia belongs in the lead paragraph
/* Forget Me Not as a symbol */ rm ovelinking
rv Holocaust Denial is covered in significant depth later, in context
it's a good idea to present all POVs
rv; Holocaust Denial material is not a RS for "disputing" figures etc
What, pray tell, does "avoid a double ambig" mean?
it's only to avoid a double ambig
article always had murdered and killed used side by side, as the overall intent to [[murder]] populations is established. it seems that one terms gradually gets removed as small edits
rv the Nazi intent to annihilate the entire European Jewry has been established; stop tagging such edits as minor
/* Forget Me Not as a symbol */ image size - was cutting off the caption
/* Resistance */ ZOB role was overrated by Communists, uprising ended after days (search-and-destroy actions followed); many fighters fled by tunnels on the Aryan Side
/* Ghettos (1940-1945) */ endemic was not incorrect, epidemic was. used another word
Hard-coded fontsize â [[Cascading Style Sheets|CSS]] class "[[MediaWiki:Common.css|references-small]]" (per [[WP:MOS#Formatting_issues|MoS]])
source of the picture I will add shortly; detailed references in articles jasenovac etc.
There were not even eleven million Jews in Europe
/* Victims */ remove POV, factual inaccuracies, myth, etc.
